author: leeastley
title: Chelsea vs Arsenal team news: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain deployed in defensive midfield, Theo Walcott starts
text:
Aaron Ramsey is likely to be out of the clash against Chelsea related stories cah-me over Tim Cahill bizarrely sent off BEFORE coming on after Melbourne Victory net controversial winner in derby FEELING BLUE Chelsea heading towards Prem trophy - but they can NEVER be classed as one of the greatest Blues teams D-DAY FOR WENGER Wenger will divide Arsenal fans more than ever if Chelsea beat Gunners and tighten grip on title race lahm the man Philipp Lahm makes 500th Bayern appearance — German is one best full-backs of his generation beijing derby Chelsea vs Arsenal in Beijing - Premier League duo to face each other in Bird's Nest Stadium this summer HIGH NOON Chelsea vs Arsenal: Follow all of the build up to crucial Premier League clash - can Antonio Conte's Blues go 12 points clear? When is Chelsea vs Arsenal and what time is kick-off? 
The match is on Saturday and kicks off at 12:30pm at Stamford Bridge. Who will be showing Chelsea vs Arsenal? 
You can watch it live on Sky Sports 1 HD, with coverage getting underway at 11:30am. Form guide: 
ARSENAL: WWWWL SunSport prediction 
After Arsenal's lacklustre performance in the 2-1 loss to Watford, all signs point to a home win. 
Chelsea have looked dominant since they were beaten 3-0 by Arsenal back in September. 
And it is hard to see how the Gunners will be able to handle the likes of Diego Costa and Eden Hazard if they are on top form. 3-1 Liverpool 1-1 Chelsea : Simon Mignolet goes from zero to hero by denying late Diego Costa penalty Getty Images Antonio Conte and Arsene Wenger face off against each other for the second time this season on Saturday Chelsea vs Arsenal - Fact me Chelsea’s 3-0 defeat to Arsenal in September was their heaviest against them since April 1997 (also 3-0). They were previously unbeaten in nine Premier League games against Arsenal (W6 D3). Arsenal have not done the double over Chelsea in the same season since 2003/04 - the season in which they last won the Premier League. The last Chelsea manager to fail to win either of his first two league games against the Gunners was Jose Mourinho in 2004/05, while the last Chelsea boss to lose both was Glenn Hoddle in 1993/94. Arsene Wenger has lost his last four league games at Stamford Bridge. The only away ground where he’s lost more in succession is Old Trafford (2009-2013). The 3-0 loss to Arsenal in September was Antonio Conte’s heaviest league defeat since October 2010 when he was manager of Siena (0-3 vs Empoli). Arsenal scored more goals in the first half against Chelsea in their last Premier League meeting than they had in their previous nine clashes with the Blues. The Gunners have had three players sent off in their last three Premier League games at Stamford Bridge (Gabriel, Santi Cazorla and Kieran Gibbs). Theo Walcott was the last Arsenal player to score at Stamford Bridge, in January 2013 in a 2-1 loss. He also scored in Arsenal’s last Premier League win there, 5-3 in October 2011. Diego Costa has scored in two of his four league games against Arsenal and has been booked in the other two. The Gunners have won three of their four Premier League London derbies this season (W3 D1 L0) – this after winning just one of their eight in 2015-16 (W1 D4 L3). They are the only team still unbeaten in London derbies this season. Chelsea have won eight successive Premier League home games – their best run in the competition since a sequence of 10 wins that ended in January 2015. The aggregate score in these eight games is 24-3 in Chelsea’s favour. Arsenal have lost as many of their last eight Premier League games as they did in their previous 30 in the competition (3)
